text:
When using stylesheets containing Greek characters (utf8-encoded) and
<xsl:output method="html" encoding="utf-8"/>, they appear as XHTML character 
entities
(like Γ) which would be ok if all Greek characters had such an equivalent,
but they don't. Accented characters are dropped.

Transformation to character entities would be great in an ISO-8859-1 setting,
but completely useless when using UTF8. The UTF8 characters should appear
verbatim to the other side. I suspect some useful default mechanism creeps
out of its rightful place and messes where it doesn't belong.
creator: dsouflis@acm.org
